definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: If chemical resistance is in question, in-plant tests are suggested.
sentences.chinese: 如果对抗化学性有疑问，建议进行工厂内部测试。

sentences.english: The chemistry of connate water can change in composition throughout the history of the rock.

sentences.english: Nitrile gloves provide even greater chemical resistance and are less likely to tear.
sentences.chinese: 丁腈手套则能提供更好的耐化学性和防穿刺性。
它们的化学性质不活泼。

sentences.english: The last column are rare gas, stable chemical properties.
sentences.chinese: 最后一列上都是稀有气体，化学性质稳定。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the effectiveness of complex treatment of eye chemical burn.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨眼化学性烧伤综合治疗的效果。

sentences.english: Chemical phlebitis always present along vein proximal to the site of injection.

sentences.english: It has good chemical resistance to greases, oils and hydrocarbons.
sentences.chinese: 它具有良好的耐化学性，以油脂，油类和碳氢化合物。

sentences.english: These two types of problems have related chemical dysfunctions in the brain.
sentences.chinese: 这两种问题在脑内有著相关联的化学性官能障碍。

sentences.chinese: 化学性质稳定，与碳共热还原为硫化钡。

sentences.english: In this paper, the properties of isospectral spectra are connected with some chemical properties and reactive activity of substances.

sentences.english: The main digestive chemical synthesized by the liver is bile.

sentences.english: Soil biological and biochemical variables are considered to be essential to measure changes in soil quality.
